alert.note: Alert for Cobb; DeKalb; Douglas; Gwinnett; North Fulton; South Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern DeKalb, Cobb, northeastern Douglas, west central Gwinnett and central Fulton Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Mount Bethel, or 9 miles east of Marietta, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Marietta, Douglasville, Decatur, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Alpharetta, Smyrna, Dunwoody, Duluth, Powder Springs, Chamblee, Norcross, Doraville, Clarkston, Austell, Avondale Estates, Berkeley Lake, Lithia Springs and North Decatur. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Cobb; DeKalb; Douglas; Gwinnett; North Fulton; South Fulton
